meanings.definition: Chafferers: people who haggle or bargain
meanings.sent1: The chafferers at the market were trying to get the best price for their goods.
meanings.sent2: The group of chafferers spent hours negotiating the terms of the contract.
meanings.sent3: The chafferers at the flea market were like skilled dancers, moving back and forth in their bargaining.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, chafferers are the conductors orchestrating the symphony of deals.
meanings.sent5: The image of chafferers haggling under the bright sun stuck in his mind.

meanings.definition: Chafferers: those who engage in negotiations or discussions for a deal
meanings.sent1: The chafferers gathered around the table to discuss the terms of the agreement.
meanings.sent2: As experienced chafferers, they knew how to navigate complex discussions with ease.
meanings.sent3: The chafferers' debate over the price of the antique vase turned into a friendly banter.
meanings.sent4: Among the chafferers, she stood out as a master of persuasive communication.
meanings.sent5: The room buzzed with energy as the chafferers delved into the details of the negotiation.
